bgu.spl.a2

Class ActorThreadPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • bgu.spl.a2.ActorThreadPool

  • public class ActorThreadPool
extends java.lang.Object
    represents an actor thread pool - to understand what this class does please refer to your assignment. Note for implementors: you may add methods and synchronize any of the existing methods in this class *BUT* you must be able to explain why the synchronization is needed. In addition, the methods you add can only be private, protected or package protected - in other words, no new public methods

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ActorThreadPool(int nthreads)
      creates a ActorThreadPool which has nthreads.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void shutdown()
      closes the thread pool - this method interrupts all the threads and waits for them to stop - it is returns *only* when there are no live threads in the queue.
      void start()
      start the threads belongs to this thread pool
      void submit(Action<?> action, java.lang.String actorId, PrivateState actorState)
      submits an action into an actor to be executed by a thread belongs to this thread pool

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActorThreadPool

        public ActorThreadPool(int nthreads)
        creates a ActorThreadPool which has nthreads. Note, threads should not get started until calling to the start() method. Implementors note: you may not add other constructors to this class nor you allowed to add any other parameter to this constructor - changing this may cause automatic tests to fail..
        Parameters:
        nthreads - the number of threads that should be started by this thread pool

    • Method Detail

      • submit

        public void submit(Action<?> action,
                   java.lang.String actorId,
                   PrivateState actorState)
        submits an action into an actor to be executed by a thread belongs to this thread pool
        Parameters:
        action - the action to execute
        actorId - corresponding actor's id
        actorState - actor's private state (actor's information)

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        closes the thread pool - this method interrupts all the threads and waits for them to stop - it is returns *only* when there are no live threads in the queue. after calling this method - one should not use the queue anymore.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread that shut down the threads is interrupted

      • start

        public void start()
        start the threads belongs to this thread pool
